intro: Egletes arkansana, commonly known as the Arkansas morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbers. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in the early morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a hairy texture. The Arkansas morning glory is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wetlands.
